sri-durga-malleswara-swamy.name: Sri Durga Malleswara Swamy

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Kanaka Durga Temple?
faq.answer: The temple is open throughout the year, but the best time to visit is during the Dasara Navaratri festival, usually in September or October, when grand celebrations take place.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple usually opens from 4:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day. However, timings may change during festivals or special pujas.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to visit the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, visitors are advised to wear traditional and modest clothing. Men should wear dhoti or pants with a shirt, and women should wear saree, salwar kameez, or long skirts.

faq.question: How can I reach the temple?
faq.answer: The temple is easily accessible. It is about 2 km from Vijayawada Railway Station and around 20 km from the airport. Autos, buses, and cabs are available.

sri-durga-malleswara-swamy.templeInfo: Sri Durga Malleswara Swamyvarla Devasthanam, is a Hindu temple dedicated to Kanaka Durga. The deity in this temple is also popularly referred as Kanaka Durga. The temple is located in Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh, India on the Indrakeeladri hill on the banks of Krishna River. Kaalika Purana, Durga Sapthashati and other Vedic literature have mentioned about Kanaka Durga on the Indrakeeladri and have described the deity as Swayambhu in Triteeya Kalpa.

steps.text: Early breakfast in Hyderabad: Hot masala dosas & filter coffee.
Drive to Vijayawada (~5 hrs, 275 km via NH 65).
Visit Yadagirigutta: Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple.
Lunch at Suruchi Restaurant: Andhra biryani and curries.
Visit Kanaka Durga Temple on Indrakeeladri hill.
Explore Undavalli Caves ‚Äì rock-cut marvel with reclining Vishnu.
Evening at Prakasam Barrage & Krishnaveni Mandapam.
Return to Hyderabad or optional overnight stay.
Breakfast in Hyderabad with idly, vada, and coffee.
Stop at Yadagirigutta Temple (~1 hr).
Visit Panakala Narasimha Temple in Mangala Giri.
Lunch at local eatery. Arrive Vijayawada, check-in.
Evening Kanaka Durga Temple darshan & walk on Prakasam Barrage.
Breakfast at hotel or local caf√©.
Undavalli Caves & Mogalrajapuram or Akkanna-Madanna Caves.
Lunch at Suruchi Restaurant.
Victoria Jubilee Museum & Bhavani Island boat ride.
Kondapalli Fort trek. Dinner at river-front restaurant.

days.title: Day 3: Vijayawada ‚Üí Nagarjuna Sagar or Return

steps.text: Breakfast, then drive (~2 hrs) to Nagarjuna Sagar Dam.
Scenic waterfall visit & lunch near dam.
Drive back to Hyderabad with tea/snack stops.
Dinner in Hyderabad.

kanipakam-vinayaka-temple.name: Kanipakam Vinayaka Temple

faq.question: What is special about Kanipakam Vinayaka Temple?
faq.answer: The idol of Lord Ganesha here is believed to be swayambhu (self-manifested) and is said to grow in size over time, making it a very powerful and sacred place for devotees.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 4:00 AM to 9:30 PM. Timings may vary on special days and festivals.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to visit the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, traditional Indian attire is preferred. Avoid wearing shorts, sleeveless tops, or western outfits.

faq.question: When is the best time to visit the temple?
faq.answer: The best time to visit is during Vinayaka Chavithi (Ganesh Chaturthi) when grand celebrations take place, or between September and March when the weather is pleasant.

kanipakam-vinayaka-temple.templeInfo: Kanipakam Vinayaka Temple is a famous and sacred temple located in Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh. It is dedicated to Lord Ganesha, also known as Sri Varasidhi Vinayaka. The idol of Ganesha is believed to be self-manifested (Swayambhu) and growing in size over time. Many devotees visit this temple to seek blessings and remove obstacles in their lives. The temple has a peaceful atmosphere and is surrounded by water. People believe that prayers here bring good luck and success. Special poojas and festivals, especially during Vinayaka Chavithi, are celebrated with great devotion and joy.

steps.text: Start from Hyderabad around 6:00 AM.
Breakfast at Hotel Suraj Grand, Kurnool ‚Äì South Indian tiffin.
Scenic break at Oravakallu Rock Garden near Kurnool.
Lunch at Blue Moon Restaurant, Nandyal.
Continue journey to Kadapa; arrive by evening.
Check-in at Zibe by GRT Hotels, Kadapa.
Dinner at Masala House, Kadapa.
Breakfast at hotel; start by 7:00 AM.
Stop at Chandragiri Fort for a quick visit.
Lunch at Hotel Bliss, Tirupati.
Visit Sri Govindarajan Swamy Temple, Tirupati.
Drive to Kanipakam and check-in at local guesthouse.
Evening darshan at Kanipakam Vinayaka Temple.
Dinner at nearby veg restaurant.
Optional morning darshan at Kanipakam Temple.
Breakfast at Hotel Sindhura near temple.
Begin return journey to Hyderabad.
Lunch at Haritha Hotel, Anantapur.
Photo break at Lepakshi Temple.
Reach Hyderabad by night.
Dinner at Hill Park or nearby restaurant.

Visit Lower & Upper Ahobilam Narasimha Temples.

Drive to Kadapa and check in.
Visit Ameen Peer Dargah (Pedda Dargah), Kadapa.
Dinner at KFC or Southern Grand Hotel.

Visit Vontimitta Kodanda Rama Swamy Temple.
Reach Tirupati by noon and check-in at Fortune Select.
Lunch at Hotel Minerva Grand, Tirupati.
Visit Kapila Theertham and ISKCON Temple in the evening.
Dinner at Bhimas Paradise.

sri-kalahasthi-swamy-temple.name: Sri Kalahasthi Swamy Temple

faq.question: What is Sri Kalahasthi Temple famous for?
faq.answer: Sri Kalahasthi is famous for its Vayu Linga (Air element) and for performing Rahu-Ketu Pooja, which helps reduce the effects of doshas related to planets in one's horoscope.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 5:30 AM to 9:00 PM every day, with special poojas and aarti performed at regular intervals.

faq.question: Do I need to book Rahu-Ketu Pooja in advance?
faq.answer: No advance booking is needed. You can buy tickets at the temple premises. Multiple ticket options are available based on seating and pooja type.

faq.question: Is there any dress code for entering the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, traditional Indian wear is preferred. Men are advised to wear dhoti or pants with a shirt, and women should wear saree or salwar kameez.

steps.text: Start early by 5:00 AM from Hyderabad.
Breakfast at Hotel Suraj Grand, Nandyal (~9:00 AM).
Lunch at Annapurna Restaurant, Kadapa (~1:00 PM).
Drive to Tirupati and check-in to hotel (by 5:00 PM).
Evening visit to Kapila Theertham and ISKCON Temple.
Dinner at Minerva Coffee Shop, Tirupati.
Breakfast at hotel; leave by 7:30 AM.
Darshan and Rahu-Ketu Pooja at Sri Kalahasti Temple (38 km).
Visit Bharadwaja Theertham & Pathala Vinayaka Temple nearby.
Lunch at Sri Sai Saravana Bhavan, near the temple.
Return to Tirupati and relax or visit Chandragiri Fort.
Dinner at Andhra Spice Restaurant, Tirupati.
Breakfast at hotel and check out by 8:00 AM.
Lunch at Subbayya Gari Hotel, Mydukur or Kurnool.
Return drive to Hyderabad by night (~8:00 PM).
Dinner en route or at home.

Dinner at hotel and overnight stay in Nandyal.

sri-kalahasthi-swamy-temple.templeInfo: Sri Kalahasthi Swamy Temple is a famous Shiva temple in Andhra Pradesh, known as the 'Kashi of the South.' It is dedicated to Lord Shiva, worshipped here as Vayu Linga (Air Element). The temple is also known for Rahu-Ketu poojas, which many people perform to remove bad effects in life. Built near the Swarnamukhi river, it has beautiful carvings and peaceful surroundings. The temple‚Äôs main attraction is its powerful spiritual energy and deep connection to the five elements of nature. Devotees believe visiting this temple brings blessings, peace, and protection from negative forces.

sri-mallikarjuna-swamy-srisailam.name: Sri Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple Srisailam

faq.question: What is special about Sri Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple?
faq.answer: This temple is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva and one of the 18 Shakti Peethas, making it a very powerful and sacred place for Hindus.

faq.question: What are the temple timings for darshan?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 4:30 AM to 10:00 PM, with specific timings for Suprabhata Seva, Archana, and evening Aarti. It's best to check the official website or local updates before visiting.

faq.question: How can I reach Srisailam Temple?
faq.answer: You can reach Srisailam by road from Hyderabad (around 215 km). Buses and private vehicles are available. The nearest railway station is Markapur Road, and the nearest airport is in Hyderabad.

faq.question: Is there any online booking for darshan or accommodation?
faq.answer: Yes, online booking is available for darshan tickets and rooms through the official temple website: www.srisailadevasthanam.org.

sri-mallikarjuna-swamy-srisailam.templeInfo: Sri Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple in Srisailam is a very famous and holy temple in Andhra Pradesh. It is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva and also one of the 18 Shakti Peethas. The temple is located on a hill and surrounded by beautiful forests. Lord Shiva is worshipped here as Mallikarjuna and Goddess Parvati as Bhramaramba. Many people visit this temple for blessings, peace, and spiritual power. The temple has ancient carvings, a big courtyard, and a peaceful atmosphere. It is a great place for both pilgrims and nature lovers. Srisailam is also known for its ropeway, dam, and boating in the Krishna River.

steps.text: Start early from Hyderabad around 5:00 AM.
Breakfast at Hill Park Restaurant, Kalwakurthy (around 7:00 AM).
Darshan at Sri Mallikarjuna Swamy and Bhramar Amba Devi temples (by 10:30 AM).
Lunch at Haritha Hotel, Srisailam (1:00 PM).
Visit Pathala Ganga via ropeway or steps.
Optional: Short visit to Sikharam viewpoint.
Begin return journey by 4:30 PM.
Snack break at Forest Checkpost Cafe, Domal Penta.
Dinner at Hotel Abhiruchi, Kalwakurthy (around 8:00 PM).
Reach Hyderabad by 10:30 PM.
Depart from Hyderabad by 6:00 AM.
Breakfast at 7 Food Court, Kalwakurthy (8:00 AM).
Scenic ghat road drive; stop at Octopus Viewpoint.
Reach Srisailam by 12:30 PM; check-in at Haritha Resort.
Lunch at Haritha Restaurant.
Evening darshan at Sri Mallikarjuna & Bhramaramba Devi Temples.
Sunset trek to Sikharam (around 2 km).
Dinner at Sri Sai Mess or resort restaurant.

Lunch at Hotel Surya Grand, Kalwakurthy (2:00 PM).
Evening tea at Hill Park on NH765.
Arrive in Hyderabad by 6:30 PM.

mahanandi-swamy-temple.name: Maha Nandi Swamy Temple

faq.question: What is special about Maha Nandi Swamy Temple?
faq.answer: Maha Nandi Swamy Temple is known for its natural water spring that flows near the Shiva Linga. The water is cool, clear, and considered sacred.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day. Timings may vary on special days or festivals.

faq.question: Is there any entry fee to visit the temple?
faq.answer: No, there is no entry fee to visit Maha Nandi Swamy Temple. It is open to all devotees.

faq.question: Is there any online booking for darshan or accommodation?
faq.answer: Yes, online booking is available for darshan tickets and rooms through the official temple website: www.srisailadevasthanam.org.

mahanandi-swamy-temple.templeInfo: Maha Nandi Swamy Temple is a famous and peaceful Shiva temple located in Nandyala, Andhra Pradesh. It is one of the nine Nandi temples known as Nava Nandis. The main attraction here is the clear, cool water spring inside the temple that flows near the Shiva Linga all the time. Devotees believe this water is holy and healing. The temple is surrounded by green forests and hills, making it a very calm and spiritual place to visit. Many people come here to pray, take a dip in the sacred pool, and enjoy the natural beauty. It is a perfect spot for both devotion and relaxation.

days.title: Day 1: Hyderabad to Nandyal via Kurnool

steps.text: Start early from Hyderabad around 6:00 AM by car.
Breakfast at Hill Park Restaurant, Jadcherla (8:00 AM).
Lunch at Suraj Grand Hotel, Kurnool (1:00 PM).

Reach Nandyal by 4:30 PM and check into a hotel like RRR Grand or Haritha Hotel.

Visit Mahanandi Swamy Temple by 8:30 AM; take a holy dip and explore the temple complex.
Visit Navanandis nearby ‚Äì Shivanandi, Prathamanandi, Garudanandi, etc.
Lunch at local temple-side eateries serving veg meals.
Evening visit to Yaganti Temple (1.5 hrs drive) if time permits.
Return to Nandyal for dinner and rest.

Lunch at Hotel DVR Mansion, Kurnool (12:30 PM).
Visit Alampur Jogulamba Temple en route for a spiritual stop.
Tea break at Drive-In 7, Jadcherla.
Reach Hyderabad by 6:30 PM.

kasapuram-nettikanti-anjaneya-swamy-temp.name: Kasapuram Nettikanti Anjaneya Swamy Temple

faq.question: Where is Kasapuram Nettikanti Anjaneya Swamy Temple located?
faq.answer: The temple is located in Kasapuram village, near Guntakal town in Anantapur district, Andhra Pradesh.

faq.question: What is the best time to visit the temple?
faq.answer: Saturdays are considered very auspicious, and many devotees visit on this day. The Hanuman Jayanti festival is also celebrated grandly here.

faq.question: Are there any special poojas or rituals at the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, special poojas, abhishekams, and sevas are performed regularly. Devotees also offer coconuts and perform pradakshinas (circumambulations).

faq.question: Is accommodation available near the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, there are a few lodges and guest houses in Guntakal, which is just a few kilometres away from the temple.

kasapuram-nettikanti-anjaneya-swamy-temp.templeInfo: Kasapuram Nettikanti Anjaneya Swamy Temple is a famous and powerful Hanuman temple located near Guntakal in Andhra Pradesh. Devotees believe that Lord Hanuman here listens to their prayers and removes problems from their lives. The temple is known for its special poojas and vibrant Saturdays, when many people visit to seek blessings. It has a peaceful and spiritual vibe, and the idol of Lord Hanuman is said to be very old and full of divine energy. Many devotees walk barefoot to the temple to show their devotion. It's a must-visit place for Hanuman followers.

steps.text: Start from Hyderabad at 5:00 AM by car.
Breakfast stop at Food Pyramid, Kurnool by 7:30 AM.

Reach Hyderabad by 10:30 PM.

Lunch at Suruchi Restaurant, Kurnool by 1:00 PM.
Check-in to hotel and rest.
Evening visit to Konda Reddy Fort and dinner at RR Family Restaurant.
Early breakfast at hotel and leave by 7:30 AM.
Darshan at Kasapuram Temple by 10:00 AM.
Explore Gooty Fort till 2:00 PM.
Lunch at Sri Sai Hotel, Guntakal around 2:30 PM.
Drive back to Kurnool, dinner at Green Leaf Restaurant.

dwaraka-tirumala-temple.name: Dwaraka Tirumala Temple

faq.question: What is Dwaraka Tirumala famous for?
faq.answer: Dwaraka Tirumala is famous for the temple of Lord Venkateswara, also known as Chinna Tirupati. It is a popular pilgrimage site in Andhra Pradesh.

faq.question: What are the temple timings of Dwaraka Tirumala?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 4:00 AM to 9:00 PM. However, timings may vary during festivals and special events.

faq.question: How to reach Dwaraka Tirumala?
faq.answer: Dwaraka Tirumala is well-connected by road. It is about 40 km from Eluru and can be reached easily by bus, taxi, or private car.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to enter the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, visitors are advised to wear traditional and modest clothes while visiting the temple to maintain the sacred atmosphere.

dwaraka-tirumala-temple.templeInfo: Dwaraka Tirumala is a famous temple town in Andhra Pradesh, known for the shrine of Lord Venkateswara, also called Chinna Tirupati. It is a peaceful place where thousands of devotees come to pray and seek blessings. The temple is located on a small hill and surrounded by greenery, making it a beautiful and spiritual place. Many people visit this temple during festivals and special occasions. The place is well-connected by road and is a great destination for a short spiritual trip with family or friends.

Continue the drive towards Eluru enjoying the scenic highway.

annavaram-satya-narayana-swamy.name: Annavaram Temple

faq.question: What is Annavaram Temple famous for?
faq.answer: Annavaram Temple is famous for the temple of Lord Sri Veera Venkata Satyanarayana Swamy, which is a prominent pilgrimage site in Andhra Pradesh.

faq.question: What are the temple timings of Annavaram?
faq.answer: The temple is generally open from 4:00 AM to 9:00 PM. Timings may vary during festivals or special events.

faq.question: How to reach Annavaram?
faq.answer: Annavaram is well-connected by road. It is around 45 km from Kakinada and can be easily reached by bus, taxi, or private car.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to enter the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, visitors are requested to wear traditional and modest clothes while visiting the temple.

annavaram-satya-narayana-swamy.templeInfo: Annavaram is known for the grand temple of Lord Sri Veera Venkata Satyanarayana Swamy. The temple is situated on a hilltop offering a serene and peaceful environment, attracting thousands of devotees for blessings. It is a highly revered site and an important place of worship in the region.

simhachalam-varaha-laxminarasimha-swami-.name: Simhachalam Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple

faq.question: What is Simhachalam Temple famous for?
faq.answer: Simhachalam Temple is famous for the rare idol of Lord Narasimha that combines the forms of both Varaha (boar) and Narasimha (lion-man).

faq.question: What are the temple timings of Simhachalam?
faq.answer: The temple is generally open from 4:00 AM to 9:00 PM. The idol is covered in sandalwood paste and revealed once a year during Chandanotsavam.

faq.question: How to reach Simhachalam?
faq.answer: Simhachalam Temple is located around 20 km from Visakhapatnam and can be accessed by taxi, bus, or private car.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to enter the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, visitors are requested to wear traditional and modest clothes while visiting the temple.

simhachalam-varaha-laxminarasimha-swami-.templeInfo: Simhachalam Temple is one of the most prominent temples in Andhra Pradesh, dedicated to Lord Narasimha, an avatar of Lord Vishnu. The temple is situated on a hill and attracts thousands of devotees throughout the year.

steps.text: Start early from Hyderabad by car.
Breakfast at Nellore Mess, Suryapet (South Indian tiffins).
Arrive at Vijayawada by noon.
Lunch at Sweet Magic near Benz Circle.
Visit Kanaka Durga Temple.

kanaka-mahalakshmi-temple.name: Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple?
faq.answer: The best time to visit is during the festival of Diwali and other special occasions, as the temple is beautifully decorated and celebrations are grand.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple opens from 5:00 AM to 12:00 PM in the morning and from 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM in the evening. Timings may vary during festivals.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to visit the temple?
faq.answer: Yes, visitors are advised to wear modest and traditional clothing. Men should wear dhoti or pants, and women should wear sarees, salwar kameez, or long skirts.

faq.question: How can I reach the temple?
faq.answer: The temple is located in the heart of Visakhapatnam and is easily accessible by auto, bus, or taxi. The nearest railway station is Visakhapatnam Railway Station, around 6 km away.

kanaka-mahalakshmi-temple.templeInfo: Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple is dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi, located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. The temple is known for its peaceful ambiance, attracting devotees seeking blessings for wealth, prosperity, and good fortune. It is one of the prominent temples in the region, known for its grandeur and spiritual significance.

Visit the Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple for morning darshan.
Explore the nearby attractions like Kailasagiri Hill and Rishikonda Beach.

lakshmi-narasimha-swamy-temple-mangalagi.name: Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple

faq.question: What is special about Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Mangalagiri?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 7:00 AM to 1:00 PM and again from 4:00 PM to 8:30 PM, but timings may vary on festival days.

faq.question: What are the temple timings?
faq.answer: The temple is usually open from 5:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day. Timings may vary on special days or festivals.

faq.question: Is there any dress code to visit the temple?
faq.answer: Visitors are expected to wear modest and traditional clothes as a mark of respect while entering the temple.

faq.question: How can I reach Mangalagiri temple?
faq.answer: Mangalagiri is well connected by road and is located between Vijayawada and Guntur, making it easy to reach by bus, car, or train.

lakshmi-narasimha-swamy-temple-mangalagi.templeInfo: Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Mangalagiri is dedicated to Lord Narasimha, an avatar of Lord Vishnu. The temple is known for its serene atmosphere and unique ritual of offering jaggery water to the deity. It is one of the eight sacred places of Lord Vishnu, and the temple offers a peaceful hilltop view of the surrounding area.

steps.text: Start your day early from Hyderabad around 5:00 AM by car.
Stop for breakfast at N Grill in Nalgonda or 7 Food Court near Choutuppal by 7:30 AM.
Continue your drive via NH65, enjoying scenic views and smooth roads.
Reach Mangalagiri by 11:30 AM and visit Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple and Panakala Narasimha shrine.
Lunch at Hotel Minerva Grand Vijayawada or RR Durbar.
Visit Undavalli Caves, about 25 minutes away.
Leave around 4:30 PM for return journey.
Stop for evening snacks or tea at Highway Grand, Narketpally.
Reach Hyderabad by 9:30 PM and have dinner at home or Paradise Restaurant, Punjagutta.
Leave Hyderabad at 6:00 AM by car.
